title: Genesis Chapter 39 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Genesis chapter 39 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Genesis Chapter 39 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Genesis Chapter 39.

questions.question: Who bought Joseph in Egypt according to Genesis 39:1?
questions.correctAnswer: Potiphar
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:1 states that Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh, bought Joseph from the Ishmeelites.

questions.question: What was Joseph's position in Potiphar's house as described in Genesis 39:4?
questions.correctAnswer: Overseer of the house
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:4 says Joseph was made overseer over Potiphar's house and all that he had.

questions.question: True or False: Genesis 39:2 says the LORD was with Joseph, and he was a prosperous man.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:2 clearly states that the LORD was with Joseph and he was prosperous.

questions.question: What did Joseph's master leave in Joseph's hand according to Genesis 39:6?
questions.correctAnswer: All that he had
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:6 says Potiphar left all that he had in Joseph's hand, except he knew not what he had except the bread he ate.

questions.question: Who cast her eyes upon Joseph and asked him to lie with her in Genesis 39:7?
questions.correctAnswer: Potiphar's wife
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:7 states that Potiphar's wife cast her eyes upon Joseph and asked him to lie with her.

questions.question: How did Joseph respond to Potiphar’s wife's request according to Genesis 39:8?
options: He refused and said it would be wickedness
questions.correctAnswer: He refused and said it would be wickedness
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:8-9 shows Joseph refusing her and explaining it would be a great wickedness and sin against God.

questions.question: True or False: Joseph listened to Potiphar's wife day by day and eventually gave in to her request as per Genesis 39:10.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:10 says Joseph did not listen to her to lie by her or be with her.

questions.question: What did Joseph leave in the hand of Potiphar's wife when he fled in Genesis 39:12?
questions.correctAnswer: His garment
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:12 tells that Joseph left his garment in her hand and fled out of the house.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Genesis 39:9: 'How then can I do this great wickedness, and sin against ______?'
questions.correctAnswer: God
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:9 shows Joseph stating he would sin against God if he committed the wickedness.

questions.question: What accusation did Potiphar's wife make against Joseph in Genesis 39:14?
options: He came to mock her and lie with her
questions.correctAnswer: He came to mock her and lie with her
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:14 says she accused Joseph of bringing an Hebrew to mock them and attempt to lie with her.

questions.question: True or False: According to Genesis 39:20, Joseph was put into a prison where the king’s prisoners were bound.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:20 confirms Joseph was put into the king’s prison.

questions.question: Who showed mercy to Joseph and gave him favor in the prison according to Genesis 39:21?
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:21 states that the LORD was with Joseph, showed him mercy, and gave him favor in the sight of the prison keeper.

questions.question: What responsibility did the keeper of the prison give Joseph according to Genesis 39:22?
questions.correctAnswer: Charge over all the prisoners
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:22 says the keeper committed to Joseph's hand all that were in the prison.

questions.question: According to Genesis 39:5, what did the LORD do for the Egyptian’s house because of Joseph?
questions.correctAnswer: Blessed it
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:5 states that the LORD blessed the Egyptian's house for Joseph's sake.

questions.question: What did Potiphar's wife do with Joseph's garment until her husband came home according to Genesis 39:16?
questions.correctAnswer: Laid it up by her
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:16 says she laid up Joseph's garment by her until Potiphar came home.

medium.title: Genesis Chapter 39 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Genesis Chapter 39 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is facing temptation at work to compromise their integrity. Based on Genesis 39, what biblical truth would you share about resisting temptation?
options: Temptation can be overcome by trusting God and staying obedient
It is acceptable to give in to avoid conflict
Ignoring temptation will make it disappear
Only strong people can resist temptation
questions.correctAnswer: Temptation can be overcome by trusting God and staying obedient
questions.explanation: Joseph refused to sin against God despite repeated temptation from his master's wife (Genesis 39:7-10), demonstrating that faithfulness and obedience enable resisting temptation.

questions.question: How does Genesis 39 teach us about faithfulness in our daily work?
options: Faithfulness leads to God's blessing and prosperity
Work is only a means to survive
It doesn't matter how we work as long as we pray
God only blesses religious leaders' work
questions.correctAnswer: Faithfulness leads to God's blessing and prosperity
questions.explanation: Joseph was faithful in serving Potiphar, and the LORD prospered all that he did (Genesis 39:2-5). This shows that God rewards faithful work with blessing.

questions.question: A believer is falsely accused and feels hopeless. What lesson from Joseph's experience in Genesis 39 would encourage them?
options: God remains with us and shows mercy even in unjust trials
God abandons us when falsely accused
We must prove our innocence by any means
questions.correctAnswer: God remains with us and shows mercy even in unjust trials
questions.explanation: Though Joseph was falsely accused and imprisoned, the LORD was with him, showed him mercy, and gave him favor even in prison (Genesis 39:20-21).

questions.question: What does Genesis 39 teach about humility and trust in God's providence during adversity?
options: Trusting God leads to favor and responsibility even in hardship
Adversity means God has abandoned you
We should rely only on our own strength
questions.correctAnswer: Trusting God leads to favor and responsibility even in hardship
questions.explanation: Joseph trusted God, and despite being imprisoned, he was given charge over the other prisoners because the LORD was with him and made his work prosper (Genesis 39:21-23).

questions.question: How does Genesis 39 illustrate the importance of integrity in marriage relationships?
options: Joseph respected his master's marriage by refusing to sin with his wife
Marriage boundaries can be ignored under pressure
It's acceptable to pursue desires despite marriage vows
questions.correctAnswer: Joseph respected his master's marriage by refusing to sin with his wife
questions.explanation: Joseph acknowledged the sacredness of marriage and refused to commit adultery, saying it would be a great wickedness and sin against God (Genesis 39:8-9).

questions.question: A believer struggles with discouragement after being wrongly accused. What encouragement does Genesis 39 offer about the fruit of steadfastness?
options: God blesses steadfastness with favor and responsibility despite trials
Giving up is the best option
questions.correctAnswer: God blesses steadfastness with favor and responsibility despite trials
questions.explanation: Joseph remained steadfast and God gave him favor in the prison, entrusting him with the care of other prisoners (Genesis 39:21-22).

questions.question: How does Genesis 39 emphasize the power of God's presence in our work and life?
options: God's presence brings prosperity and success
Success depends only on human effort
God's presence is irrelevant at work
questions.correctAnswer: God's presence brings prosperity and success
questions.explanation: The LORD was with Joseph and caused everything he did to prosper, both in Potiphar’s house and in prison (Genesis 39:2-3, 23).

questions.question: True or False: Joseph's refusal to sin was based solely on fear of his master discovering him.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Joseph refused because it would be a great wickedness and sin against God, not just fear of his master (Genesis 39:9).

questions.question: True or False: Despite being a prisoner, Joseph was given authority over all the other prisoners and was successful in that role.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The keeper of the prison entrusted Joseph with all the prisoners, and he succeeded because the LORD was with him (Genesis 39:22-23).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Joseph's master, Potiphar, put _______ in Joseph's hands because he saw that the LORD was with him.
questions.correctAnswer: all that he had
questions.explanation: Potiphar entrusted all that he had to Joseph because he saw the LORD was with him and made his work prosper (Genesis 39:4-6).

questions.question: How does Joseph's example in Genesis 39 encourage us about God's faithfulness during unjust suffering?
options: God remains with His servants and blesses them even in suffering
God abandons those who are unjustly treated
Suffering means God is punishing us
We must seek to escape suffering at all costs
questions.correctAnswer: God remains with His servants and blesses them even in suffering
questions.explanation: Though Joseph was falsely accused and imprisoned, God showed him mercy and gave him favor, demonstrating His faithfulness (Genesis 39:20-23).

questions.question: What does Genesis 39 teach about stewardship and responsibility in everyday life?
options: Faithful stewardship leads to greater trust and blessing
questions.correctAnswer: Faithful stewardship leads to greater trust and blessing
questions.explanation: Joseph was made overseer over all Potiphar’s house and possessions due to his faithfulness, and the LORD blessed the house for his sake (Genesis 39:4-5).

questions.question: How does Joseph's response to temptation teach us about honoring God in difficult situations?
options: Honoring God means refusing sin even when pressured
God does not care about daily choices
questions.correctAnswer: Honoring God means refusing sin even when pressured
questions.explanation: Joseph refused to sin against God despite repeated pressure, showing obedience and reverence for God's commands (Genesis 39:7-10).

questions.question: What does Genesis 39 teach about God's blessing in the context of work and family life?
options: God blesses households when His servants are faithful
God only blesses individuals, not families
questions.correctAnswer: God blesses households when His servants are faithful
questions.explanation: Because of Joseph's faithfulness, the LORD blessed Potiphar’s household and all his possessions (Genesis 39:5).

questions.question: How does Joseph's example in Genesis 39 inspire us to maintain godly character despite false accusations?
options: Maintaining integrity leads to God's favor even amid injustice
Integrity is not important when misunderstood
questions.correctAnswer: Maintaining integrity leads to God's favor even amid injustice
questions.explanation: Joseph kept his integrity and God gave him favor in prison despite false accusations (Genesis 39:20-23).

questions.question: In Genesis 39, who purchased Joseph and brought him to Egypt?
questions.correctAnswer: Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh
questions.explanation: Joseph was sold by the Ishmaelites to Potiphar, who was an officer of Pharaoh, captain of the guard (Genesis 39:1).

hard.title: Genesis Chapter 39 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Genesis Chapter 39.

questions.question: Who purchased Joseph after he was brought down to Egypt?
questions.correctAnswer: Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:1 states that Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh, bought Joseph from the Ishmaelites.

questions.question: What reason is given in Genesis 39 for Joseph's prosperity in Potiphar's house?
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD was with Joseph
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:2-3 emphasizes that the LORD was with Joseph and caused all he did to prosper.

questions.question: What role did Joseph assume in Potiphar's household?
options: Overseer over his house and all he had
questions.correctAnswer: Overseer over his house and all he had
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:4 explains that Joseph was made overseer over the house and all that Potiphar had.

questions.question: What effect did Joseph's presence have on Potiphar's household and fields?
options: The LORD blessed the Egyptian's house because of Joseph
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD blessed the Egyptian's house because of Joseph
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:5 states that the LORD blessed Potiphar’s house and all he had because of Joseph.

questions.question: How does the narrative describe Joseph's physical appearance?
questions.correctAnswer: A goodly person, well favored
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:6 describes Joseph as a goodly person and well favored, which sets the stage for the temptation by Potiphar’s wife.

questions.question: What was Potiphar’s wife's request of Joseph?
questions.correctAnswer: Lie with me
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:7 records Potiphar's wife asking Joseph to lie with her, initiating the temptation.

questions.question: What reason does Joseph give for refusing Potiphar's wife's advances?
options: It would be a great wickedness and sin against God
He was loyal to his family
questions.correctAnswer: It would be a great wickedness and sin against God
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:9 shows Joseph refuses because it would be a sin against God and a breach of loyalty to his master.

questions.question: How does Joseph demonstrate his integrity when Potiphar's wife attempts to seize him?
options: He flees, leaving his garment in her hand
questions.correctAnswer: He flees, leaving his garment in her hand
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:12 narrates Joseph fleeing and leaving his garment behind to escape temptation.

questions.question: What accusation does Potiphar's wife make against Joseph after he flees?
options: He tried to mock her and lie with her
He ran away to another land
He was a spy for the Ishmaelites
questions.correctAnswer: He tried to mock her and lie with her
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:14-15 record her false accusation that Joseph came to mock and lie with her.

questions.question: What action does Potiphar take after hearing his wife's accusation against Joseph?
options: He sends Joseph back to his family
questions.correctAnswer: He puts Joseph into prison
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:20 states that Potiphar took Joseph and put him into the prison where the king's prisoners were bound.

questions.question: Despite being imprisoned, what continues to be true about Joseph's life?
options: The LORD was with Joseph and showed him mercy
Joseph lost all favor and hope
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD was with Joseph and showed him mercy
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:21 affirms that the LORD was with Joseph in prison and showed him mercy.

questions.question: What responsibility is given to Joseph while he is in prison?
options: He was made overseer over all the prisoners
He was kept in solitary confinement
He was assigned manual labor in the fields
He was released to serve Potiphar's household
questions.correctAnswer: He was made overseer over all the prisoners
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:22 says the keeper of the prison put all the prisoners under Joseph’s care.

questions.question: What literary device is evident in the way Joseph's integrity and God's favor are portrayed before and after his imprisonment?
options: Chiasm, showing a parallel structure of favor and trial
questions.correctAnswer: Chiasm, showing a parallel structure of favor and trial
questions.explanation: The narrative forms a chiastic structure: Joseph prospers due to God's favor, faces trial through temptation and imprisonment, but God's favor remains constant (Genesis 39:2-23).

questions.question: True or False: Joseph's refusal to sin against God connects to New Testament teachings on resisting temptation.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Joseph's moral integrity in Genesis 39:9 parallels New Testament exhortations to resist temptation and sin (e.g., James 1:12-15).

questions.question: The Hebrew word used for 'overseer' in this chapter suggests what about Joseph's role in the ancient Egyptian household?
options: He had administrative authority over the estate
He was merely a servant with no authority
He was a slave without any responsibilities
questions.correctAnswer: He had administrative authority over the estate
questions.explanation: The term for overseer indicates Joseph was entrusted with managerial responsibilities typical in Egyptian estates (Genesis 39:4).

theological.title: Genesis Chapter 39 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Genesis Chapter 39 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What theological truth is illustrated by God's presence with Joseph and his resulting prosperity in Potiphar's house?
options: God blesses and prospers those who remain faithful and obedient
Prosperity is guaranteed to all who live in Egypt
Joseph succeeded by his own wisdom and strength
God only blesses those outside of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: God blesses and prospers those who remain faithful and obedient
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:2-3 shows that the LORD was with Joseph, causing him to prosper. This reflects the biblical doctrine that God blesses the faithful, consistent with Deuteronomy 28:1-14, Psalm 1:1-3, Proverbs 3:5-6, and Matthew 6:33.

questions.question: How does Genesis 39 portray Joseph's response to temptation from Potiphar's wife?
options: He refuses, citing loyalty to his master and sin against God
He gives in but repents later
questions.correctAnswer: He refuses, citing loyalty to his master and sin against God
questions.explanation: Joseph explicitly refuses her advances, recognizing the sin against God (Genesis 39:8-9). This reflects the biblical teaching on resisting temptation (James 1:13-15, 1 Corinthians 10:13, Matthew 26:41, Hebrews 12:1).

questions.question: What does Joseph leaving his garment in the hand of Potiphar's wife signify in the narrative?
options: He physically separates himself from sin and provides evidence of his innocence
He offers it as a gift
He gives it to her as a bribe
questions.correctAnswer: He physically separates himself from sin and provides evidence of his innocence
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:12-13 shows Joseph fleeing, leaving his garment behind. This symbolizes his deliberate rejection of sin and serves as evidence in the false accusation, paralleling the principle of fleeing sin in 2 Timothy 2:22, Psalm 119:11, Proverbs 4:14-15.

questions.question: What attribute of God is highlighted by His continued presence and favor with Joseph even while he was imprisoned?
options: God's mercy and faithfulness to His servants
questions.correctAnswer: God's mercy and faithfulness to His servants
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:21 describes the LORD showing mercy and giving favor to Joseph in prison, emphasizing God's steadfast love and faithfulness (Psalm 23:6, Lamentations 3:22-23, Hebrews 13:5, Romans 8:38-39).

questions.question: How does the chapter depict Joseph's role in God's providential plan?
options: A faithful servant through whom God's blessing flows despite adversity
A passive victim with no control over his fate
An independent ruler who ignores God
A man who relies solely on human schemes
questions.correctAnswer: A faithful servant through whom God's blessing flows despite adversity
questions.explanation: Joseph's faithfulness and God's blessing in both Potiphar's house and prison (Genesis 39:4-5, 39:22-23) show God's providence working through trials, consistent with Romans 8:28, Proverbs 3:5-6, and Psalm 105:17-19.

questions.question: Which doctrine is illustrated by Joseph's refusal to sin against God despite the temptation and personal risk?
options: The doctrine of sanctification and obedience to God
The doctrine of predestination to sin
The doctrine of salvation by works alone
questions.correctAnswer: The doctrine of sanctification and obedience to God
questions.explanation: Joseph's refusal (Genesis 39:9-10) exemplifies sanctification—the process of living in obedience to God despite temptation (1 Thessalonians 4:3, Romans 6:12-14, Colossians 3:5-10, 1 Peter 1:15-16).

questions.question: What does the false accusation against Joseph by Potiphar's wife reveal about human sinfulness and injustice?
options: Human sinfulness can cause innocent people to suffer unjustly
Injustice never occurs in godly households
Suffering always results from personal sin
questions.correctAnswer: Human sinfulness can cause innocent people to suffer unjustly
questions.explanation: Potiphar's wife's false accusation (Genesis 39:14-18) shows how sin can lead to injustice, echoing biblical themes of innocent suffering in Psalm 37:12-13, Job 1-2, Isaiah 53:7, and 1 Peter 2:19-21.

questions.question: How is the sovereignty of God demonstrated in Joseph's story in this chapter?
options: God is sovereign over both blessing and suffering, orchestrating events for His purpose
God loses control when injustice occurs
God only acts to reward the righteous immediately
God is unaware of human affairs
questions.correctAnswer: God is sovereign over both blessing and suffering, orchestrating events for His purpose
questions.explanation: The chapter shows God's sovereign hand blessing Joseph in adversity (Genesis 39:2, 39:21, 39:23), consistent with Job 42:2, Proverbs 16:9, Romans 8:28, and Ephesians 1:11.

questions.question: What aspect of human character does Joseph's behavior towards Potiphar's possessions teach?
options: Faithful stewardship and integrity in entrusted responsibilities
questions.correctAnswer: Faithful stewardship and integrity in entrusted responsibilities
questions.explanation: Joseph was made overseer of all Potiphar's house and possessions and managed them faithfully (Genesis 39:4-6), illustrating stewardship principles found in Luke 16:10, 1 Corinthians 4:2, Colossians 3:23, and Proverbs 27:23.

questions.question: What does Joseph's experience in prison teach about God's presence in suffering and trials?
options: God remains present and grants favor even in hardship
God abandons His people in prison
Suffering is always a sign of God's rejection
Prison is the end of God's blessing
questions.correctAnswer: God remains present and grants favor even in hardship
questions.explanation: Genesis 39:21-23 affirms that the LORD was with Joseph in prison, showing His continual presence and blessing despite adversity, paralleling Psalm 34:18, Hebrews 13:5, 2 Corinthians 12:9, and Isaiah 43:2.

questions.question: How does Joseph’s declaration about sinning against God in Genesis 39:9 contribute to Christian understanding of sin?
options: Sin is ultimately a personal offense against God
Sin only affects relationships between people
Sin is insignificant if it is kept secret
Sin is only a social crime
questions.correctAnswer: Sin is ultimately a personal offense against God
questions.explanation: Joseph states that committing adultery would be sinning against God (Genesis 39:9), underscoring that sin is primarily an offense against God's holiness, consistent with Isaiah 59:2, Psalm 51:4, James 4:17, and Romans 3:23.

questions.question: In what way does Genesis 39 demonstrate the doctrine of divine justice amidst human injustice?
options: God ultimately ensures righteous outcomes despite temporary injustice
Human justice always aligns perfectly with divine justice
God is indifferent to unjust suffering
questions.correctAnswer: God ultimately ensures righteous outcomes despite temporary injustice
questions.explanation: Though Joseph is unjustly imprisoned (Genesis 39:19-20), God's blessing and ultimate plan prevail (Genesis 39:21-23), illustrating divine justice as in Psalm 37:28, Ecclesiastes 12:14, Romans 12:19, and Revelation 21:4.

questions.question: What Christological type can Joseph be seen as in Genesis 39?
options: A suffering servant who remains faithful and is exalted by God
A rebellious figure rejected by God
questions.correctAnswer: A suffering servant who remains faithful and is exalted by God
questions.explanation: Joseph’s faithfulness in suffering and eventual exaltation anticipates Christ’s role as the faithful suffering servant (Isaiah 53, Hebrews 12:2, 1 Peter 2:21-23, Philippians 2:7-8).

questions.question: Which attribute of God is most clearly revealed by His favor upon Joseph even in difficult circumstances?
questions.correctAnswer: God's grace and sustaining power
questions.explanation: God’s favor on Joseph in prison (Genesis 39:21) shows His grace and sustaining presence, consistent with 2 Corinthians 12:9, Psalm 46:1, Isaiah 40:29, and Philippians 4:13.

questions.question: How does Genesis 39 contribute to the doctrine of human responsibility in the face of temptation?
options: Humans are responsible to resist temptation and not sin against God
Humans have no power to resist temptation
Temptation is always a test from God to punish
questions.correctAnswer: Humans are responsible to resist temptation and not sin against God
questions.explanation: Joseph’s active refusal (Genesis 39:10-12) teaches human responsibility to resist temptation, supported by James 4:7, 1 Corinthians 10:13, Matthew 26:41, and Galatians 5:16.

questions.question: What does the narrative teach about God's providential care over non-Israelites through Joseph's service in Egypt?
options: God's providence extends to all peoples and nations
God’s blessings are exclusive to Israelites only
questions.correctAnswer: God's providence extends to all peoples and nations
questions.explanation: Joseph’s service in an Egyptian household (Genesis 39:1-5) shows God's providence over Gentiles, consistent with Genesis 12:3, Psalm 67:1-2, Acts 10:34-35, and Romans 11:11-12.
